did.abstract: This collection contains personal papers of William R. Ross spanning the period 1943 to 1947. Most items pertain to the death of Ross's son, William Richard Ross, in 1945, and include a brief obituary, a memorial service guest book, a sympathy card, and bills from the funeral. Other materials include correspondence with the Sons of the American Revolution and one Jacob Gunther concerning mortgages at 483 Logan Street in Brooklyn. Materials indicate that from 1943 to 1947 William R. Ross resided or worked at 16 Court Street, 101 Clark Street, and 185 Montague Street in Brooklyn.
